kick-start.translation[0].definitions[0]: to do something to help a process or activity start or develop more quickly
He urged further interest rate cuts in a bid to kick-start the economy.
kick-start.translation[0].definitions[1]: to start a motorcycle using your foot
kick-start.translation[1].definitions[0]: the part of a motorcycle that you press with your foot to start it
kick-start.translation[1].definitions[1]: action taken to make a plan, project etc start or develop more quickly
Motivation is the kick-start you need to succeed at work.
